descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of place value relationships.
Student struggles to explain the relationship between adjacent place values.
Student partially understands the relationship between adjacent place values, with some inaccuracies.

Student accurately explains that a digit in one place represents 10 times as much as it represents in the place to its right or 1/10 of what it represents in the place to its left, but struggles to provide clear examples.

Student clearly explains that a digit in one place represents 10 times as much as it represents in the place to its right and 1/10 of what it represents in the place to its left, and provides accurate examples.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of place value relationships, clearly explaining and illustrating with multiple examples how digits in different places relate to each other, including non-adjacent places.
Student cannot apply place value understanding to solve problems.
Student attempts to apply place value understanding but makes significant errors.
Student can apply place value understanding to solve simple problems, but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Student consistently applies place value understanding to accurately solve most problems.
Student effectively applies place value understanding to accurately solve complex problems and explain their reasoning.
Student expertly applies place value understanding to solve complex problems, explains their reasoning clearly, and can generalize the concept to novel situations.
